body:
**PLEASE COORDINATE WITH SIG-SCHEDULING BEFORE WORKING ON THIS ISSUE.** We want to avoid the situation where two people accidentally start work on the same fix.
Main tracking issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68951

Constructing a `Scheduler` object requires a lot of boilerplate, as evidenced by the code in `cmd/kube-scheduler`. It requires calls to `NewConfigFactory` followed by `CreateFromConfig` or `CreateFromProvider` and finally a call to `NewFromConfig`.

We should create a function `New` in the main scheduler package `k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/scheduler` that combines all the arguments from the existing, multi-step process. ~~This constructor should take a `SharedInformerFactory` arg instead of individual informers.~~ This constructor will take each informer and lister as a separate arg, so that the types we care about are implicitly documented. For optional arguments, we should use the [“functional options” pattern](https://dave.cheney.net/2014/10/17/functional-options-for-friendly-apis).

To start, the new constructor can be implemented by calling the existing ones. Shuffling the code around and deleting old constructors will come later.

See also: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68955

/sig scheduling
/kind cleanup
/help
/good-first-issue
